entry.title: Featured Travel Topic
entry.content:
Featured Travel Topic

Dehydration

A condition that may affect travellers in many places and for many reasons. Never pleasant, sometimes fatal.

entry.title: Off the Beaten Path
entry.content:
Off the Beaten Path

El Cuyo

El Cuyo beckons to visitors looking for a quiet, natural seaside town to bask in the sun undisturbed by revelers while other visitors seek adrenaline-pumping excitement.

entry.title: Destination of the Month
entry.content:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

entry.title: eating salmon on Christmas
entry.content: ... that a Japanese ministry promotes eating salmon on Christmas?

entry.title: a cave shrimp from Christmas Island
entry.content: ... that a cave shrimp from Christmas Island was christened xmas and heralded on Christmas Day?

entry.title: How to Survive Christmas
entry.content: ... that the author of How to Survive Christmas described the season as a "rat race"?

entry.title: a giant Santa statue
entry.content: ... that a website has ranked a giant Santa statue as the world's most "unintentionally creepy Christmas ornament"?

entry.title: Arceuthobium johnianum
entry.content: ... that all four known fossils of the dwarf mistletoe Arceuthobium johnianum have been lost?

entry.title: drawing of Eve and a pregnant Mary
entry.content: ... that an Iowa nun's drawing of Eve and a pregnant Mary was described as "simple yet theologically dazzling"?

entry.title: a book about a Finnish Santa figure
entry.content: ... that a book about a Finnish Santa figure sold particularly well in Germany and Japan?

entry.title: XMAS
entry.content: ... that the 2025 UK Christmas number-one single, "XMAS", made Kylie Minogue the oldest woman to top the UK singles chart with a new recording?

entry.title: The Dream of Saint Joseph
entry.content: ... that The Dream of Saint Joseph (pictured) by Philippe de Champaigne was owned by Napoleon's half-uncle?
